title: Macbook Air 820-00165 - A - Chai Late Damage - lost cause?
message:
A client brought in a board heavily damaged by her chai late.

About 1cm of the board all the way along the top was submerged. 

I've US'd the board and cleaned it off so it looks nice and clean now. However we have no light on the charger and no life signs.

I suspect the circuit below is damaged and that D7012 needs to be replaced as all the voltages before that point seem to match my good board. Somehow that area also had corrosion... But the majority of the liquid "was" on the other side of the board. 

Given the extent of the ingress is it worth proceeding or is it a waste of time?

[ATTACH type="full"]59320[/ATTACH]

[ATTACH type="full" width="406px"]59319[/ATTACH]

title: Macbook Air 820-00165 - A - Chai Late Damage - lost cause?
message:
If you mean C7012, is not so important as schematic makes you think-
We need voltages to make an idea...

title: Macbook Air 820-00165 - A - Chai Late Damage - lost cause?
message:
Hi

I mean D7012. 
I was cleaning off the corrosion and it broke in half, so now it's definitely a problem. I will attempt to replace and post back. 

PPCDV IN @R702 is 18.44v
DCIN ISOL GATE is 18.22v
PP18v5DCIN ISOL R
PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H 0v

title: Macbook Air 820-00165 - A - Chai Late Damage - lost cause?
message: D7012 is very important; board cannot start if no good.
